intro: Eryngium ebracteatum var. typicum, commonly known as the narrowleaf thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It features upright, spiny stems and narrow, gray-green leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces blue to purple spherical flower heads composed of small, tubular florets. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in prairies and open woodlands. Its distinctive appearance makes it a notable component of native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
